reviews.text: There is a large stone covered area, like a large town square at the Town Hall. There are sidewalk cafes, many kinds of shops, and an information/visitors office where you can look for maps, tours, info, etc. At opposite end of square from Town Hall is a beautiful large cathedral.  Mozart and Handel played the large pipe organ there back in the day.
Beautiful building and area.
Historic City
Very nice place, have been inside and its just as nice there as from the outside
No need to watch your wallet here
Ok
Niet voor bezoekers toegankelijk
Liked it, it has been the bridge between the roads in Amsterdam. Sculptures places there is awesome & I must admit that it displays the excellence of Dutch architecture.
This is a neat structure, the old Port guard for entry into the city. It is worth the stop for a for op but there is little else to see beyond the building itself.
Nice old city gate, add it on your itinerary!

This  one of the old City gates. It took a lot of time by walk to reach there from the Harlem stations. If you are on the way to some where else, then  stopping on this spot to take pictures is worth it.
A beautiful little castle in Haarlem!

This was one of the smoothest car sale transactions ever. Not only did I get an excellent quote by Ryan B, but even the closing process was faster than I thought. Julian T, was very courteous and accommodating as well.
I’ve been with Texas Direct Auto for all my trade ins and car buys, but today was by far the best experience of all.
Thank you Ryan and Julian. Good luck and God Bless !

Every car is so clean and looks like new. Contacted them through email one night, and got an answer back early the next morning. I arrived at 2pm, and left the car I wanted at a great price. We will be back!

This  is perfect for your car sake needs. Their price is good and the staff is helpful. Veronica Ramirez was specifically very helpful in getting the paperwork pulled together when I was in a rush. Also Mark Washington was a great assessor and he worked through some things that I asked for him to consider.

Overall I would recommend this place.

John Sousa really appraised my car at good price. Really happy with appraised value. Got really good value of my old car. Also Julian Trevino provided good customer service. It was really easy to sell car at Texas auto.

I cannot say enough about this place! I have purchased now 2 vehicles from them and have had the best experiences each time. No haggling, great customer service! Sales, financing and service are absolutely wonderful! I would highly recommend to anyone looking to purchase a vehicle. Speak to Chris I in sales, and Tommy in financing. Sheila in service was very helpful and prompt address my needs. Will tell everyone to buy your next car at Texas Direct Auto!
Nice place where you can spend time on fresh air
Love this place. Being in the forest and riding around, listening to birds and looking at the trees.

A quiet open park just outside of the city centre. 
Often used for small festivals or open air concerts and our biggest celebration of our liberation.

There is plenty of space to lay down and relax, or take a have walk on the many pathways. 

Enough trash cans to keep it clean, parking is difficult, so take a bike. 

There is a pancake restaurant located in the middle, and a beer deer enclosure to watch.
This park as not that big but very old and looks like some mystery forest. Don’t forget to visit deer farm across the road
Love this place
Best windmill details given. All done by volunteers. Superb knowledgeable staff who are able to give very detailed explanation to all questions.
I leaned a lot about windmills. It was 5€ for entrance and the tour. The tour was about 30 min and quite informative. Nice view from the deck.

Had a very Informational tour of this windmill, superb views when you get to the top.
If your ever in Haarlem you have to take a tour
A beautiful place, closed when we visited. A little piece of Dutch history. Would have loved to enter.

The windmill is beautiful. The entrance is ridiculously cheap, and you get to learn a lot of interesting information. The view is very nice too. 

However, the tour guide was incredibly rude, to me and my friend. She said things such as; "We are in the most free country in the world so I can say whatever I want" and "We are almost communists here" (have you experienced communism lady?!), "Tell me where you're from so I can see how to treat you". She kept poking at me and my friend to tell her where we came from, and when we said Utrecht, she started questioning what language were we speaking. I snapped and asked her "How is this relevant for the tour". The other people joining the tour seemed very pleased with my answer and even applauded. Her response was "I don't usually drink, but today I will need a drink". Very very rude. 

I am sad I could not enjoy this experience to the fullest.

Excellent homely art gallery.  Lots of galleries on ground floor of former men's almshouse close to city centre.  Whilst Frans Hal's forms the centrepiece, the majority of art is by his Haarlem contemporaries and others who painted local scenes.  Hals was merely one of the leading artists of his time, and didn't become really famous until he was discovered by the French impressionists in the 1800s who were inspired by his brushwork.

Each room has a theme to aid comparison.  I didn't appreciate the few bits of modern art that had been added as comparators.  Some stunning floral displays in different rooms.  I spent about an hour wandering round, then enjoyed twenty minutes dozing in the sunny central courtyard before a brief stop in the shop.
Superb museum, lots of interesting displays. I had my preconceptions of 17th century Dutch art blown wide open. Wonderful. ☺
Very worth while museum to see the old Dutch masters. We were also in a fun portrait painting workshop. The coffeeshopppe inside seemed really nice.
A must see museum if you're serious about understanding Dutch art and the centuries long impact on international art. Well presented and easy to understand.
Nice museum with a beautiful collection. The location of the building is wonderful, downtown Haarlem with nice shops nearby.
Má administração do poder público. Patrimônio histórico, sem seu devido valor por mídias, pelo  governo, total falta de respeito, valorização.
variedade muito grande pra conhecer bastante oisa
Bom para ter lazer
Local de fácil acesso e um clima de paz
.Muito  bom  pra saber istorias de bauru um ótimo lazer

Tours in Dutch and English at fixed timings, with possible reservations online five days in advance. Each tour takes 20 people maximum due to the small confines of the house. Tours last 60 minutes and are free.
The stairs are narrow and high. The Hiding Place is available for visitors to climb into but also very tight. 
The speaker was excellently descriptive and the small museum is well curated. There is a small shop at the end of the tour.
Photos were discouraged as they tend to slow the tour down, which runs on a tight schedule. Last tour (Dutch) ends at 3pm.

The Ten Boom house has been preserved with a good deal of care. The tour is pretty well done by a volunteer who recounts many of the details of the family's work in the Dutch resistance, their arrest, and subsequent history. The hiding place itself is fascinating, and gives a great visual to the description of everything from how quickly the Ten Booms could move their Jewish guests upstairs to the smallness of the space where they were concealed.

An amazing, really miraculous story.

Very interesting place! Don't miss it! I had an extraordinary guide, I think her name is Lisa (?), She was telling us the ten boom family story, as if she was really there. She new all kind of fascinating details, ones can not even imagine to think of.
I strongly recommend you to get the guided tour and donate few euros, or perhaps buy a copy of the diary in your own language (I did).

Very good and interesting. Tours alternate between dutch and english and are every half hour. Free tour with a donation box and small store at the end. You can even go inside of the hiding place where the Jews were.

The museum is only accessible through free guided tours that last about an hour. Tours are available in English and Dutch and are led by passionate volunteers. I went in knowing nothing about Corrie and left knowing something, so I guess the educational aspect of the tour succeeded. You get to step into the actual hiding place where 6 refugees hid for over 2 days in the freezing cold, as well as see the original trapdoor mechanism. The place isn't wheelchair accessible and the stairs are narrow so be careful if you're carrying around a big bag like I was. Was also cool to find out the house was actually two houses joined together by a ship's mast. Pick up a bookmark souvenir for only 0.2€!
Very nice food and friendly service, at affordable prices
Unfailingly good quality: menu, service; with an informal friendly ambience. No razzmatazz, just a great Haarlem experience.
Good food!
Glad they had extra options on the menu for me, since I eat gluten-free. Good place to go with a group of people. Wide selection of food and drinks
Food=5 (great Menu for €24,5), Service=5, Atmosphere=4.
Fantastic restaurant! Novel foods, fantastic service, affordable and a mesmerising location. What more can of wish for?
Was really impressed: the food was delicious, the place is authentic and very welcoming

Hier hebben we echt van genoten. Goede gerechten, lekkere wijn, gezellige sfeer en een mooi sociaal concept. Een vers broodje met kruidenolie en een amuse van het huis. De huisgerookte zalm was niet te rokerig en de bijpassende mierikswortel mousse was heerlijk. Het hoofdgerecht met skrei (vis) was erg mals en het hoofdgerecht met varkensbuik was precies wat het moest zijn. Misschien miste deze laatste ergens nog een krokante bite. Maar de smaak was geweldig. De toetjes waren een echt hoogtepunt. Bij de reservering was gemeld dat een van ons jarig was en dus werd hier even aandacht aan besteed. Dat maakt het goede gevoel net even af! Top. Een echte aanrader!
Super leuke tent, het eten is erg goed en bijzonder. Ook de prijzen zijn zeer netjes evenals de bediening.

Erg knus en sfeervol restaurant, midden in een klooster. Goede prijs/kwaliteit verhouding. Eten was erg lekker en het concept erg goed. Restaurant heeft een goed maatschappelijk initiatief door jongeren te begeleiden.

Great food & good value! Beautifully located in the heart of the pittoresk city center of Haarlem. In a stylish ambiance you can discover the rich flavours of the Indonesian cuisine. I recommend the authentic “rice table dish” where fresh crispy veggies are served with tasteful spicy proteins. The authentic rice table dish was officially admitted as Dutch Cultural Heritage in 2015.
Delicious food and nice service. Also nice statues and small art collection (museum) inside.

Great location.  Great service.  We got a "deluxe" version of their "rice table", a collage of 8 Indonesian dishes ranging from chicken to pork to beef.  A flavorful spread.  If you have a chance to experience it, you should try it.  Extensive wine list.  Very good beer list.  Great service in a very cozy intimate setting.  We cannot wait to come back.
Reservations here are essential as it is a very popular and busy restaurant. The food here is amazing and if you love your Indonesian it's a must visit. Great staff and service as well.
Good Dutch-Indies/Indonesian food restaurant! Tasty and fresh food. Nice updated and clean place.
